intro: Alisma superbum, commonly known as marsh plantain, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It features slender, erect stems that can grow up to 60 cm in height, often with lance-shaped leaves that are slightly hairy. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to thrive in water-saturated soils. Alisma superbum is an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
